rComments: This man is smart and he adds a lot of good material to the class. He is one of the best professors I have ever had. His exams are a little tough but it is not bad. Just do the problems from the book and do your practice exams and you will do good in the class.

I don't know if it was because I had taken this course at my community college, but it was pretty boring throughout the quarter. The class was decent overall, and the mathematical manipulation are continuous in the homework and tests.

Joel Primack is a good man, and a decent Professor. He is kind of a boring a lecturer, so I skipped and read the textbook. He is a boss, but it doesn't really show in his teaching. However, it is worth noting that I had him for a relatively simple introductory course, and he may have been as bored as I.

Primack didn't seem to care a bunch about the class -- lectures would mainly consist of him going off on tangents. It was interesting, but not really useful. Tests were pretty fair and HW wasn't too bad, but the book was a much more useful learning tool than lecture. Not a bad teacher, just not the best. He's an interesting man though.

Primack is ...smart, but not a great teacher. There is no way to know what he expects from you. He comes across as very casual when giving assignments, and then he grades them quite harshly! -no feedback either!

If you love having no clue what's expected of you or what you'll be graded on, Joel is the professor for you. Make sure to read his mind before turning anything in. Long random tangents and constant bragging about his past accomplishments are other high points of Joel's teaching. Nice smile though.

At first his lectures were difficult to understand, but he seemed to improve greatly towards the middle of the course. The final exam was fairly straight forward. Very nice during office hours, talk to him if you're interested in finding out more about his amazing career and physics background!

If at all possible, do not take this class, and possibly this series without taking at least MATH 23B. If you take MATH 24, you'll be set for PHYS 5B. I wish they'd make these courses prerequisites instead of co-requisites. The class is not worth it. He describes uses of electrical components that you can think up of yourself.

He messes up explanations frequently in class. When I review my notes, I find that he's made several _fundamental_ mistakes. Today he flipped the equation for capacitance, and then had the audacity to make comments on how charge, capacitance, and voltage relate based on a flawed equation. Someone corrected him later on luckily. Egotistical too!
JOEL!!!!!!!! Very fun class, he was always very intresting. The class is no cake walk but it was fun none the less. Sometimes his lectures were confusing but he is totally awsome.

Joel Primack is one of the most intelligent professors you will ever meet.  However, his ability to teach concepts is not that good.  A lot of times, he explains things very quickly, and expects students to have a certain level of understanding. the final just caught the whole class off guard in terms of how impossible it was! He does curve though!

While Primack means well and is generally jovial about physics, he lacks the ability to clearly articulate his ideas and to help other students understand the principles he covers. He also generally holds to Mr. Dorfan's notion that modern physics texts are worthless and instead chooses to use an antiquated and confusing book.
BEST PHYSICS TEACHER ON EARTH literally! just dont ask any "whats a vector" questions, cuz that annoys everyone
This was an AWESOME class, and its awesomeness was derived from Dr. Primack himself.

Primack is a good lecturer and very passionate about physics, aside from being a genius. Some people have criticized him for being arrogant, but I disagree--although admittedly it's probably unavoidable when you're one of the world's top physicists. I asked a ton of questions, and he knows me by name now, so he can't be too arrogant.

Dr. Joel Primack is, in fact, the greatest professor in the history of professors.  He literally knows everything.  If you do not take any of his classes, you are missing out on perhaps the greatest experience in your entire lifetime.  He is also the leading theorectical cosmologist in the world.
